snippet: Before a convention of minority journalists, the Democratic nominee said she “may have short-circuited” when asked about her private email use in two recent interviews....
abstract: Hillary Clinton, speaking before National Assn of Black Journalists and National Assn of Hispanic Journalists, says she 'may have short-circuited' during television interview in which she stated FBI director James B Comey had said she was truthful in her statements about use of private email server while secretary of state; it is first time in 200 days that Clinton has fielded extensive questioning from journalists.

byline.original: By YAMICHE ALCINDOR and AMY CHOZICK
byline.contributor: Yamiche Alcindor reported from Washington, and Amy Chozick from New York.

lead_paragraph: Before a convention of minority journalists, the Democratic nominee said she “may have short-circuited” when asked about her private email use in two recent interviews.

headline.main: A ‘Short-Circuit’ on F.B.I. Inquiry? Hillary Clinton Seeks to Explain
headline.print_headline: Did She ‘Short-Circuit’ on the F.B.I. Inquiry? Clinton Seeks to Explain
